noun.description: A person working in but not living in an institution, such as a nonresident doctor or other worker in a hospital.
(in a strictly enclosed order of nuns) a sister who does not live exclusively within the enclosure and goes on outside errands.

origin: Mid 16th century (as an adjective in the sense external): from French externe or Latin externus, from exter outer. The word was used by Shakespeare to mean outward appearance; current noun senses date from the early 17th century.
